OUS: From a moral point of view, we should feel obliged to give one of our kidneys to a person with kidney failure since we do not need two kidneys to survive, but really only one to be healthy.
Answers georgesung/llama2_7b_chat_uncens: I agree with the statement.  Reason: From a moral point of view we should feel obliged to give one of our kidneys to a person with kidney failure since we do not need two kidneys to survive but really only one to be healthy. This is because we have an obligation to help others in need and giving a kidney is a selfless act that can save someone's life. Additionally we have the resources and ability to donate a kidney which is a relatively simple and low-risk procedure. Therefore we should feel obliged to give one of our kidneys to a person with kidney failure.
